description:
The Finance Operations team manages Google's cash transactions on a global basis and ensures that Google's incoming and outgoing cash processes are controlled, effective and efficient. As a member of this team, you'll find innovative ways to manage our complex set of transactions. You thrive on making processes more efficient and scalable, you work to ensure the highest level of quality of our operations and you proactively minimize operational risk. Externally, you collaborate with our outsourcing partners and internally, you collaborate across the five areas of the Financial Operations team: Global Revenue Operations, Procure to Pay, Electronic Payment Services, Business Process Outsourcing, and Payroll.

The Customer and Partner Operations (CPO) team manages Google's Order-to-Cash (O2C) processes globally across all product areas, including Ads, Digital Goods, Google Cloud and Hardware. We ensure that Google acts in an efficient, controlled and compliant manner. Our team powers Google's growth agenda by creating innovative ways to manage our complex set of billing and payments, making processes more efficient and scalable, and minimizing operational risk.

The Electronic Payment Services (EPS) team (part of CPO) is growing. You have a passion for payments, an interest for making big improvements to our financial processes and a desire to make things work on a global scale. On the EPS team, you will be working with Finance, Legal, Product, Payments and Engineering teams to drive improvements in Google’s profits and losses through credit card declines optimization efforts, driving improvements in chargeback win rates and identifying and implementing methods to reduce processing fees.

The name Google came from "googol," a mathematical term for the number 1 followed by 100 zeros. And nobody at Google loves big numbers like the Finance team when providing in depth analysis on all manner of strategic decisions across Google products. From developing forward-thinking analysis to generating management reports to scaling our automated financial processes, the Finance organization is an important partner and advisor to the business.

qualifications:
Minimum qualifications:

  • 10 years of experience in finance operations and process design.
  • 5 years of experience in managing vendors and running global operations.
  • 5 years of experience managing operations in the payments, money transmitter, banking, or FinTech industry.

Preferred qualifications:

  • MBA degree.
  • Demonstrated experience and success in leading and developing teams with a focus on performance, mentoring and collaboration.
  • Demonstrated ability to work in a customer-facing or partner-facing role.
  • Ability to work in a cross-functional team environment.
  • Excellent project management skills and attention to detail.
responsibilities:
• Manage a team and third party service providers to drive improvements for Google. Partner with Product and Engineering teams to solve complex payment problems and innovate on new opportunities.
  • Lead internal projects, follow best practices and optimize end-to-end payments processes while executing on potential savings measures and influencing payment partners.
  • Advocate with banks, card networks, associations and partners to improve end-to-end payment operations across the industry.
  • Work with Engineering, Finance, Treasury and other Google teams to manage and resolve day-to-day escalations with partners, manage key controls and ensure compliancy.
  • Act as a trusted advisor to internal stakeholders to ensure alignment of business requirements and payment options, including management of outsourced providers to ensure consistent monitoring of key partner performance metrics.
title: Global Process Owner, Controls and Optimization
